to turn away, i.e. (morally) be refractory

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

27.brief: an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
remoteness, i.e. (concretely) a distant place; often (adverbially) from afar
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
a conflagration (from the rising of smoke)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

28.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
to gush; by implication, to inundate, cleanse; by analogy, to gallop, conquer
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
the back of the neck (as that on which burdens are bound)
to cut or split in two; to halve
to quiver (i.e. vibrate up and down, or rock to and fro); used in a great variety of applications (including sprinkling, beckoning, rubbing, bastinadoing, sawing, waving, etc.)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
a halter (as restraining); by implication, the jaw
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the cheek (from its fleshiness); hence, the jaw-bone
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

29.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to be (causatively, make, pronounce or observe as) clean (ceremonially or morally)
a festival, or a victim therefor
the heart (as the most interior organ);
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

30.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)
a descent, i.e. imposition, unfavorable (punishment) or favorable (food); restfulness
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon

31.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to prostrate; hence, to break down, either (literally) by violence, or (figuratively) by confusion and fear
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)

32.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a crossing-place (of a river, a ford; of a mountain, a pass); abstractly, a transit, i.e. (figuratively) overwhelming

a branch (as extending); figuratively, a tribe; also a rod, whether for chastising (figuratively, correction), ruling (a sceptre), throwing (a lance), or walking (a staff; figuratively, a support of life, e.g. bread)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
a brandishing (in threat); by implication, tumult; specifically, the official undulation of sacrificial offerings
to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)

33.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
to be (causatively, make) deep (literally or figuratively)
to broaden (intransitive or transitive, literal or figurative)
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)
a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
properly, cypress-resin; by analogy, sulphur (as equally inflammable)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
